summary: April 21 is the 111th day of the year  in the Gregorian calendar.
full_text: Ludovico  Carracci  was an Italian, early-Baroque painter, etcher, and printmaker born in Bologna. His works are characterized by a strong mood invoked by broad gestures and flickering light that create spiritual emotion and are credited with reinvigorating Italian art, especially fresco art, which was subsumed with formalistic Mannerism. He died in Bologna in 1619.
title: Ludovico Carracci
